thread.title: Star holds off Ginebra to take Game 1 of Manila Clasico semis
thread.title_full: Star holds off Ginebra to take Game 1 of Manila Clasico semis

author: Alyssa Rola
title: Star holds off Ginebra to take Game 1 of Manila Clasico semis
text: PBA Star holds off Ginebra to take Game 1 of Manila Clasico semis (UPDATED) The Star Hotshots draw first blood, closing out the game late after an acrobatic Paul Lee runner in the lane Published 9:21 PM, February 09, 2017 Updated 1:03 AM, February 10, 2017 HOT SHOOTERS. Paul Lee overcame a slow first half to finish with 18 points and 5 rebounds, including a game-sealing floater in the lane. Photo by Czeasar Dancel/Rappler MANILA, Philippines (UPDATED) – Star Hotshots pulled away with a 78-74 Game 1 victory against old rivals Barangay Ginebra to draw first blood in the best-of-7 semifinals in the 2017 PBA Philippine Cup on Thursday, February 9, at the Smart-Araneta Coliseum. Paul Lee led the way for Star with a game-high 18 markers and 8 rebounds, while Mark Barroca and Marc Pingris combined for 26. Pingris also grabbed 12 boards and dished out 5 assists for the Hotshots, who outscored Ginebra in the paint 44-28. The Gin Kings, who are riding their built momentum after ousting twice-to-beat Alaska in the quarterfinals, led by as much as 10 with 9:18 left in the second quarter following consecutive triples from Chris Ellis and Jervy Cruz. The third-seed Hotshots quickly bounced back in the opening minute of the second half as a Barroca three-pointer tied the game at 40. Lee provided the final push for Star after connecting with a floater with under 30 seconds left in the low-scoring affair. Chris Ellis anchored the seventh-seed Ginebra with 12 points on 4-of-6 shooting, while Scottie Thompson contributed 7 markers coupled with 10 boards. Japeth Aguilar put up 11 points and 6 rebounds, while Sol Mercado and Jervy Cruz added 10 apiece for the Gin Kings. Game 2 of the Manila Clasico series is on Saturday, February 11, at the MOA Arena. Scores: STAR (78): Lee 18, Barroca 17, Pingris 9, Sangalang 8, Maliksi 7, Jalalon 6, Melton 5, Reavis 5, Dela Rosa 2, Ramos 1, Brondial 0 GINEBRA (74): Ellis 12, Aguilar 11, Mercado 10, Cruz 10, Tenorio 8, Thompson 7, Ferrer 7, Marcelo 5, Mariano 4 Quarter scores : 14-19, 37-38, 60-58,78-74. – Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
